properties.areaDesc: Coastal Waters From Cape Flattery To James Island 10 To 60 Nm; Coastal Waters From James Island To Point Grenville Out 10 Nm; Waters From James Island To Point Grenville 10 To 60 Nm; Coastal Waters From Cape Flattery To James Island Out 10 Nm; Coastal Waters From Point Grenville To Cape Shoalwater Out 10 Nm; Coastal Waters From Point Grenville To Cape Shoalwater 10 To 60 Nm
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued January 1 at 8:43AM PST until January 2 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Small Craft Advisory, west winds 20 to 30 kt with
gusts up to 40 kt and seas 16 to 19 feet at 19 seconds. For the
Gale Watch, southwest winds 25 to 40 kt with gusts up to 50 kt
and seas 15 to 20 feet at 15 seconds possible.

* WHERE...Coastal Waters from Cape Flattery to Cape Shoalwater
out to 60 nm.

* WHEN...For the Small Craft Advisory, until noon PST Thursday.
For the Gale Watch, from Thursday afternoon through late
Friday night.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds can cause hazardous seas which could
capsize or damage vessels and reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
A Small Craft Advisory means that wind speeds of 21 to 33 knots
and/or seas 10 feet or higher are expected to produce hazardous
wave conditions to small craft. Inexperienced mariners,
especially those operating smaller vessels should avoid
navigating in these conditions.

A Gale Watch is issued when the risk of gale force winds of 34 to
47 knots has significantly increased, but the specific timing
and/or location is still uncertain. It is intended to provide
additional lead time for mariners who may wish to consider
altering their plans.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST THURSDAY... ...GALE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT
